intro: Casearia solida, commonly known as the hardy casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Salicaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Casearia solida thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate to flourish.
